recommendations: Obtain STAT serum creatinine and BUN to calculate eGFR. Proceed with CT Pulmonary Angiography only if eGFR is sufficient for contrast administration, with appropriate hydration.
If eGFR is < 30 mL/min/1.73m², consider Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) scan as an alternative for PE evaluation.
If eGFR is ≥ 30 and < 60 mL/min/1.73m², use low-osmolar contrast, minimize volume, and administer IV hydration.
Document a renal risk assessment and obtain informed consent prior to contrast administration.
rationale: Missing renal function data (eGFR, creatinine, BUN) prevents safe contrast administration.
Patient's acute presentation of shortness of breath and chest pain is concerning for PE, necessitating evaluation.
Low-dose CT chest is not indicated for acute symptoms and does not evaluate pulmonary arteries.
Alternative non-contrast imaging (V/Q scan) is recommended for potential renal impairment.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~100–150 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ensure contrast-to-eGFR ratio <1.1 g/(mL/min); if eGFR <30, consider non-contrast alternatives or weigh risks carefully.

protocol_selection.name: Ventilation-Perfusion (V/Q) Scan
protocol_selection.description: A two-part nuclear medicine imaging study to assess for pulmonary embolism by evaluating airflow (ventilation) and blood flow (perfusion) to the lungs.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Non-contrast modality, suitable for patients with renal impairment.
